data.text:
Go To Page 1

Veteran director Spike Lee wishes Christopher Nolan's 'Oppenheimer' showed 'what happened to the Japanese people'

Filmmaker Spike Lee praised the film 'Oppenheimer' directed by Christopher Nolan but suggested that it could have shown the impact of the nuclear bombs on the Japanese people during World War II.

09 Oct, 2023, 06:32 PM IST

Oil prices spike as Saudi Arabia, Russia extend 1.3 million barrel a day oil cut through December

Saudi Arabia and Russia have agreed to extend their oil production cuts through the end of the year, leading to a reduction of 1.3 million barrels per day. This move has pushed benchmark Brent crude above $90 a barrel, a price not seen since November. The decision could lead to increased inflation and higher gasoline prices, while also putting pressure on Saudi Arabia's relationship with the United States due to its partnership with Russia.

06 Sep, 2023, 07:04 AM IST

Hip-Hop celebrates 50 years: Exploring the genre's evolution, impact & cultural legacy

Hip-hop, an American creation, has become a global phenomenon that has transcended boundaries, cultures, fashion, art, and politics. The genre's 50th birthday was celebrated on August 11, 2023.

11 Aug, 2023, 09:17 PM IST

Households are making a 'small switch' to deal with rising food prices

The kitchen budgets are on a tight squeeze. Therefore, the markets are witnessing a change in the spending habits of the consumers. Instead of buying fresh tomatoes, people have shifted to buying small cartons of tomato puree, from fresh ginger to single-use sachets of ginger paste and loose cumin powder to tiny 7-gm sachets, reported TOI.

Harry Belafonte passes away: Tim Cook says world has lost a 'true giant', Oprah calls him a 'trailblazer'

Harry Belafonte, a singer and actor who introduced a Caribbean flair to US music, has passed on at the age of 96. He was known to fans as the "King of Calypso" as a result of his 1956 hit "The Banana Boat Song (Day-O)" and went on to become a movie star after arriving in the film adaption of the Broadway musical, "Carmen Jones".

Chris Wallace reminds Tyler Perry of how filmmaker Spike Lee criticised his Madea character. See the response

In 2009, the filmmaker Spike Lee attacked Tyler Perry's creation of Madea, calling it out a 'coonery buffoonery.' Recently, when Perry joined Chris Wallace on his new talk show on HBO MAX, Wallace reminded him of Lee's criticism. Check out how Perry strikes back at Lee for slamming his Madea character.

Serena Williams puts off retirement with U.S. Open first round win

The victory over the 80th ranked Kovinic, just her second this year, will be a confidence boost for Williams but the path to a record equalling 24th Grand Slam now gets treacherous. Waiting in the wings is Estonian second seed Anett Kontaveit, who breezed past Jaqueline Cristian 6-3 6-0.
